Ratings.comment: Very rude professor did not help students when asking questions . Every time someone asked a question she would get very smart. For the final, we did a review that was NO help at all. She's also a very harsh grader. Would not take her unless it's your last option.

I enjoyed Dr Lindo and the material for the class, but it was definitely way too much work for a gened. I managed to get an A but this class had way too much busy work when it shouldn't have. Wouldn't recommend one way or another on this class to be honest but I didn't hate it as someone who's interested in the music we learned about.

Dr. Lindo is a nice and knowledgeable instructor. But her course had way too many things to do. For a GE class, it had more work than my Chem 1210 class. She has two quizzes, assignments in the class, and other random things every week, making it hard to keep up. She grades harshly and the class is harder than it has to be. DO NOT TAKE THE CLASS!

The pace was perfect for the dense readings and she did a great job to make the material digestible.Classes met twice a week:one for material introduction and the other for class discussions. here were bi-weekly discussion posts, a mid-semester paper, and a final paper.She's highly accessible and wants her students to succeed.10/10 recommend

super difficult to reach. if you have any medical emergencies or are unable to complete an assignment for valid reasons, and email her, she will not respond. i had to email the director of the comparative studies department to get her to respond to me and she still has ghosted me. she doesn't care about the people she teaches and is negligent.
I like Dr. Akbarian. She is very interesting. Choose her, you will never regret!
Excellent professor. I highly recommend Dr. Akbarian! Her lectures are excellent, and she takes care of the students!

Dr. Akbarian waited until the day after SEIs were due to post an assignment that was due 5 days later and was worth 62% of the overall grade. Personally, I had emailed her prior to this posting, as a graduating senior, wanting to see what the assignment was and received no reply. Very sneaky.

Dr. Akbarian is a very nice professor. Her lectures are online, but the online mode does not affect the high quality of the lectures! I learned a lot in only seven weeks. Grading is decided by 13 lecture attendances, 2~3 discussion boards, and one final essay, so the stress is not very big. Recommend Dr. Akbarian!

Amazing professor. Dr. Akbarian's lectures are very interesting. I learn a lot on her course. The tasks are not heavy, 13 lecture attendances, 3 discussion boards and 1 final essay are all tasks during the semester. You could try to discuss with Dr. Akbarian, she will be very happy to talk with you!

Dr. Akbarian is a very nice professor. She knows deeply on here area, and provide the related knowledge to us very clearly. The lecture is very funny, and the amount of task is not heavy. The whole semester, we only have three discussion boards and one final essay to complete, and the lecture attendance will be counted into final grade.
She is a very solid professor. Recommend to take her class!

Very solid professor! Her lectures were very interesting, and the course pressure was not too great. There was only lecture attendance, three discussion boards, and one final essay for grading in the whole semester. I highly recommend taking her class!
Very caring professor who wants you to learn the material. Lots of good discussions and interesting topics were looked over and very light on the homework. Overall, awesome professor!
The readings can be difficult to wrap your head around at times, but she does a good job of working through them in the lectures. If you show up to class, you'll do well.
Very solid professor

Had hope to take an African American and African Studies class to lean more about myself and my culture. What I got was a read this and tell me what you think class all semester. This was a class that I didn't learn anything in, and the reason why I didn't score as high was one my cite in text were wrong and two he didn't like my thesis statement.

Shaida is a decent person. She knows a lot about her field, but isnt always open to students thoughts. She does not accept any late work. Also, she can be a bit vague in her discussion posts, but still expects high quality work from students. The essays can hurt your grade if not done to her liking. Good class, but could be better

Shaida is a really great instructor although she maybe a bit intimidating at first. She knows her material, doesn't have dull lectures, & is reasonable. During the epidemic she was accommodate while managing the course work. Her only downside is that she doesn't update the grades online.

This teacher should resign. She doesn't care about her students or how her grades affect them. The average for our last quiz was a 4/10. She's passive aggressive when you ask her questions and acts like we aren't doing the work.   Her accent makes it difficult to understand anything she says, and she speaks too slow. The worst professor in my life!

I'm sorry but this teacher is terrible. She's a very nice woman but she gives no clarity on your current grade in the class for almost the entire quarter and students have asked her repeatedly. quizzes are excessively difficult for no reason. I feel like she just wants her students to fail, I think she should ease up this is UCR not Harvard.

I understand why students think she is hard because she is. So many readings and articles that lead up to so much, she's looking for one thing only when it has to do with topics. Literature and women in Africa, quizzes are challening because shes looking for those small things, it does bring your grade down. But she cares for students and education

A GPA bomb with a disrespectful and uncaring professor. No matter what you do, such as attending office hours you will not do well. I set the curve for her class and barely passed. Ruined several people's GPA's. The class average was 65%. Do not take. Wish I dropped the class

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. She is incredibly unclear when it comes to assignments, dates, and grading. She does not provide any type of PowerPoint or guided notes. Her grading is very hard and she does not provide any constructive feedback. She assigns several chapters of reading for each class. AVOID THIS CLASS. IT WILL RUIN YOUR GPA.

ANY other GEC will be a better option to take than this. One of the worst classes and professors I have had thus far at OSU. Very time consuming. She is very unclear about paper guidelines and avoided answering questions she didn't 'like.' Avoid if you can, very poor quality.

I would not recommend this course for most people. The reading was VERY extensive, especially for a basic GEC. Her lectures were unhelpful most days. Additionally, all of her exams were essay exams so you REALLY had to know your stuff. With that being said, I received an A in the class but it came with lots of blood, sweat, and tears...literally.

DO NOT take this course. The professor assigns lengthy readings that take up so much time considering it is only a GEC. The lectures are boring and she expects the class to lead the lecture with opinions from the reading assignments. Her grading is so unpredictable and inconsistent. She seems to be very unclear of what she is looking for on exams

Worst professor I have had so far at OSU.  She does not cover material in any sort of order and makes it unclear of what we are supposed to be learning. Her grading is completely inconsistent. For a GEC, this class is very time-consuming.She will not answer emails she doesn't like. Overall, I would not reccommed.

Do not take this class. I worked my ass off, went to her office hours and everything. She is very inconsistent with her grading and doesn't explain things at all. Unless you share the same opinion as her you are wrong. My research, with citations, was wrong in her eyes. I was told my opinion was wrong in front of the class many times.

Great professor!  She's not into holding your hand, but she WILL help you if you actively seek it.  She treats her students like responsible adults, which I appreciated. Really enjoyed her lecture, and is a very insightful thinker.  Definitely recommend.

I thought the professor was kind. However, grading was often inconsistent and instructions often weren't clear. I felt that if you didn't write about the professors opinion you got a low grade. The books we read were interesting. This class was a GEC and took more time than any of my major courses and I still only got a B.

She expected a lot out of her class, but it was all for the sake of better understanding African Literature.  She enjoyed going above and beyond her role to further explain additional information outside of the syllabus to curious students.  She's often very busy, but does everything she can to meet up with any student that needs her help.

This professor is a wonderful speaker but is very unorganized and demands a lot out of her students. Does not cover how to look at books from literary standpoint, though there are 2 papers, 6 pages and 12 pages, and a comprehenshive exam covering all 6 books! Run for your life!

Her lectures and passion for the subject make class discussion enjoyable. She was always available for questions and provides constructive feedback on writings. Highly recommend for anyone looking to deepen their cultural learning!

I've taken two of her gen ed classes so far and both times got A. She uploads EVERYTHING online so you don't have to buy books or go to the library etc but be prepared to read A LOT and participate in discussions. She gives lots of feedback on writing during office hours so make sure you do that.

Created an atmosphere where everyone could contribute to the class discussion on the readings, just the class itself required a lot of outside reading/preparing for class (for a GenEd). Papers were graded a little too sternly.

I think that considering most students don't take this course unless for a requirement, it's a surprisingly interesting course. Definitely reading heavy but discussions go very in depth about overarching themes. Ms Kipourou is a very good instructor, she cares about the topics and her students, and she consistently tries to get the best out of you.

I have the EXACT SAME COMPLAINT as the review under me. This professor has no rubrics for her assignments so she grades however she feels like it which felt biased. When you ask for feedback she gives rude responses and isn't helpful. Not good at responding to emails either and you can't miss a class. It isn't worth taking a class with her.

Dr. Kipourou NEVER gave us clear rubrics or grading criteria for any of our assignments, and would then be disappointed when we didn't follow her expectations (that were not communicated). I never felt as though my voice was valued in her class, and she was so condescending every time I met with her to talk and gave unhelpful, confusing feedback.

Prof Kipourou is one of the best professors and supporters at OSU. Go to office hours, have discussions!

The class was a bit of work for GE, but worth it in the end.

One of, if not the nicest professors I have had. She cares for her students and truly wants everyone to do well in the class and to learn something new every class. There are usually 2-3 articles assigned each class as homework but it was very manageable. Class was often very entertaining and was something to look forward to. Would recommend.
She is such an AWESOME teacher. She makes the class so interesting. She cares about her students alot and is willing to help at anytime. She assigns short stories to read for hw. Would recommend!

The grading system did not align with the syllabus. She graded few assignments, and the evaluation was unusually harsh. She was  confusing in her explanations of the texts. There was much reading especially considering that for me it was just a GE. If you do not like to participate this is not the class for you; participation is HEAVILY graded.
One of my favorite professors on campus!! She does grade the papers, so you should put effort into those but as long as you read they're easy.

Very knowledgeable about everything she teaches. She does assign a TON of reading, but they are all important to the lessons she teaches. The way she teaches class can be confusing if you aren't prepared for class. Do the work and you'll get an A!
Make sure you go to her office hours! Be receptive to her feedback and try your best and youll succeed. Dont be afraid to reach out. Communication is key and shes strict but amazing
Dr. Kipourou is one of my favorite professors. She is super accessible, gives detailed feedback on papers and did all she could to help me better my writing. Very passionate and intelligent!

Worst professor for an online class. She gave absolutely no opportunities for extra credit, and none of the grading criteria for any of the papers and assignments were clear. She ignores emails from students, and she is the least understanding and helpful professor at OSU.
Love her! She gives you lots of opportunity for extra credit!! Also going to her office hours is super helpful.

Prof. Kipourou gives thought-provoking lectures and pushes you to think in a critical way. Very organized, approachable and communicates things clearly. But be prepared for lots of reading and writing -the class I took was a second level writing one so that's to be expected.

AMFAST 1111 actualy. Good professor, contains weekly 10 question quiz on assigned readings and films. Respond to weekly discussions critiquing peers projects. Also six, 250 word reflections on diverse African topics such as universities, articles, and social media, along with a significant project due at the start of a designated week. Good GenEd.

Kelly Jo was an overall great professor. Very understanding about deadlines, and offers extra credit for great thoughtful answers. Consistent assignments, you can expect a quiz and discussion each week (more). One paper, small project, and a major final project. Timely grader with the exception of major projects. Lectures are optional but helpful.

An angel honestly. Kelly Jo was one of the most caring, fair & balanced, and informative profs I had. I took two classes, wgss/afamast/compstd 4921 (intersections) and afamast 2367 (Black women writers), and she gave me extra credit points whenever she really liked my answer or could see that I put in a lot of effort. Take her classes!

Kelly was an amazing professor! I learned a lot in her class. The course was super easy and she was really understanding with needing help, extensions, and not overwhelming us. 11/10 professor and she is super sweet!
Shes a really awesome professor and communicates with students very well

Kelly is AMAZING! she's such a sweetheart! She cares about her students and really connects and builds relationships with them. The class was extremely thought provoking and the group discussions topics were very interesting as well. You will take out of her class what you put into it!
Professor is very nice and very understanding.

> Professor who is VERY passionate about what he teaches; really encourages students to think for themselves.
> Readings can be difficult since they deal with complex philosophical concepts; in class he breaks them down.
> Attendance 10% (up to 4 extra points), 3 short papers (2-3 p. w/ prompt) 48%, Final Research Essay (8-9 p. no prompt).

This class has been one of the best I've ever taken. The readings and subject matter in general are heavy and require effort to get through, but it is well worth your time. There is a fair amount of writing but he gives great feedback and isn't a hard grader. Dr. Barchiesi is extremely passionate and his class has greatly expanded my world view.

You have 4 papers in this class. But he is a great professor. So much information but very interesting and challenging mentally. Overall he is a gem! Inspirational and he cares about his work and your ideas very much!

I took his Black Global Cultural Movements class. This was incredibly challenging in all the ways it needs to be: very abstract thought, super engaging class conversation, and a totally life/thought-expanding course. Franco is incredible. Youll work for it, but youll get a lot out of it.

This was the best class Ive taken at OSU, and it was for a GE. Franco is a fairly easy grader, but the essays for his class were DEFINITELY a lot of hard work. Francos class and assigned readings made me think in ways Ive never been encouraged to anywhere else. Loved his class and recommend if youre looking to challenge yourself in every way.

Franco is such a passionate professor. His class was lecture and reading heavy and very few grades were taken so you definitely have to work for the grade. As long as you are a good writer and do the readings you will be okay. He also offered SO MUCH extra credit for our class.

Great professor. Very kind, caring & understanding. Easy A if you go to class, skim readings, & do the essays! Attendance counts towards grade. Material is interesting. Essays were not painful. Prof is an easy grader. I got As on every essay/exam. No multiple choice exams, only essays. Midterm was open note (allowed a notecard). Take this class!!!

I took his comparative studies course on post modernity and modernity, and honestly one of my favorite classes in college yet. he's super passionate when he lectures and really cares about his students! man's a genius. take his class if you ever get the chance.

We meticulously go over the information in class so at the end of it, you will learn a lot of African history. Go to class and take thorough notes and you will be fine on the essay exams. It is very possible to get an A and it is an enjoyable class as well. Prof Barchiesi is very helpful and loves talking to interested students.

This class was very enjoyable. Attendance is mandatory, and our grades were composed of essay exams and a paper. He grades 60% of all exams and papers and the t.a's grade the rest. If you want to get an A in the class the textbook is mandatory otherwise he will penalize you on exams if you rely on the lecture notes.

A very interesting and entertaining professor. You can learn a lot from him, but there are 3 required textbooks and he grades solely by class attendance (which is mandatory) and essay exams. He is an easy grader when it comes to essays, but he gives you 20 possible essay questions from which he picks 2 at random for the final exam.

Dr. Skinner is an energetic, engaging lecturer and an excellent, knowledgeable professor. I really enjoyed the texts he chose for this class. It involves lots of reading, but the readings are generally accessible and interesting. His class made me add the AAAS major at OSU, I enjoyed it so much.
Dr. Skinner is incredibly passionate and engaging in his lectures. His class made me want to add the AAAS major.
Professor Skinner is a real gem hes very nice and down to earth. Hes really passionate about his lectures and youll enjoy them. Short quizzes every week, no exams just a few writing assignments.
i hate this dude bruh
Dr. Cash is great. Kind, funny and passionate. Requires a fair amount of work and can be slow on grading, but he cares about earning and improving your literacy. Would highly recommend.

Thank God for Dr. Cash. He inspired me to speak up for myself. I look forward to his inspirational lectures, for he brings up controversial, but important topics of discussion and he's not afraid of anyone's reaction. He radiates a vibrant energy when he speaks and he is genuinely interested in the lives of students who take his class seriously.
Extremely hard teacher
he's strict but fair and kind. to get on his good side is to visit him after class once or twice a week to talk about african heritage

VERY disorganized and changes his mind by the second. This reflects his lectures as well; most of them don't follow one specific theme. He is very passionate, though, and I enjoyed the lectures most of the time. Lots of last minute email assigns. Read & class. I basically just took notes on what he said & rewrote them in the assignments. Easyish A
Passionate. Easy to speak with. Easier to get along with. You must communicate with him to help him understand your insight.

Class has no structure. Don't expect to talk about the readings he will just go on long tangents about random topics. Hard to engage in class. Exams don't reflect what we talk about in class because what's talked about in class has nothing to do with the readings. Doesn't communicate well at all with students

This could be an easy and interesting class, but Cash makes it way to involved and is probably the worst prof I have had in college thus far. His "trips" are unrealistic as are his tests. Lectures are very unclear and he doesn't know how to communicate with students at all. This class will do nothing but hurt my GPA. AFAMAST 2281 = waste of time

I like him as a person, didn't like the class or him as a teacher.  He knew it was a GEC but expected the kind of creativity from a lit. class that you find from English majors (8 page creative nonfiction paper).  Had to drop his class because while he's passionate, he didn't explain assignments well in class and never responded to e-mails
Very easy BUT is untrustworthy.. be weary of his "class trips"

He is very passionate about the subject and I actually learned a lot. His exams are insanely hard though! He gives extra credit but almost everyone in the class left with a C because of the hard exams. Attendance is graded and the books are a must. You'll learn a lot but be prepared and he likes if you comment in class.
this guy is very good, easy to understand, but his exams are too hard.

Malcolm Cash, more like Malcolm Cashed. Like beat nuggets!. Even if you go to all his office hours he will still give you a C. He literally got in an argument at the school of law with the security guard about who has a bigger salary. He is very passionate about the topic of afro american literature.

Professor Cash is probably one of the professors on campus who loves what they teach more than anything. Pay attention and the class will be easy. He is one of my favorite professors and has a huge heart. I would recommend his class to anyone.

There is a good amount of reading, and you have to supply the various books yourself. You also have to watch films that you don't always have access to (on Amazon Prime etc.). She is a tough grader and doesn't seem like she wants to be there.
Shes rude, shes a really tough grader, I hated this class, I dont have much more to say about it. Oh and if you hate reading , dont take this class.

You should never take this professor. This professor is really hard. This is not a class that should be taken if you don't know anything about visual arts. She says that you need to have co-curriculars before this class, so find out what those are before you even take this class. Even if you try your hardest you still will receive a horrible grade.

I'm shocked that she is still able to teach. The lack of professionalism, genuine care for students, and clear expectations of the writing projects were shocking and only surpassed by her sour attitude, eye rolls, and clear unhappiness to teach. She clearly embodies a professor who wishes to research but has no interest in teaching.
tough grader, don't recommend,participation is very important

Dr. Drake came into class acting like it was going to be super tough and stated that she expects her students to know prerequisite material even there there was no prerequisite course. She did not put up the information to do her assigned homework, so work could not be completed on time. Acted like this class was not a priorityimportance to her.

She doesn't seem like she wants to instruct students and VERY unprofessional. She was eating food while teach us in one of her classes. She was reported to the Deans office as well. DO NOT TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR!!!

Dr. Drake is not an easy professor. She expects you to attend class, be involved and engaged. She is one of the best professors i have had, not because she is fun but because she pushes you. We had to write three papers, she gave feedback on all three, which was useful. She doesn't do well with tardy or uninvolved students. She expects effort.

All the people complaining are the ones who didn't DO anything in the class but sit in the back and talk and/or not go to her office hours, which she ALWAYS commented on no one using. Everything I wrote had feedback on it -- some good, some bad, but all of it was helpful. You'll be a better writer after a class with her.
She lectures and thier is no substance to her lectures.  She's unapprochable.  She just assigns a grade to your paper.  there are no remarks or feedback.  Avod her at all costs.

Avoid this professor at all costs! Her class was completely worthless, there was no structure and the readings were difficult and weren't even necessary for the papers. She takes off lots of points on the 4 papers, for things she doesn't even tell you are required, she just expects you to know how to do things her way. Stay away at all costs.

The worst!  Avoid her at all cost!  This is the only class that I have taken where I learned absolutely nothing!  You are better off joining a book club if you want to waste time talking about ideas - rather than learning.

She is a very easy teacher. Only thing you do is read the novels assigned and talk about them in a discussion in class. We rarely got homework. You might get a paper here and there. You dont even have to read the novels just make sure you say something to get a participation grade. Thats it, it is a easy class

I had her for engineering survey and she wasn't really helpful at all. Our class focused too heavily on diversity and our class had no idea about anything that was being taught in the other survey courses like contacting advisors, application to major, etc. I'm just glad we didn't have to attend class after 7 weeks, as our time was wasted in there

I think this was Jeter-Bennet's first class. She's pretty cool, and the assignments aren't hard to keep up with, but she was clearly aiming to make the class as easy as possible. If you want an easy A and GE credit, take this class with her. If you want a truly robust analysis of history that requires deep thought, don't bother.
Class had lots of reading, but the in class discussions and his in depth knowledge more than made up for it. Pushes you to become a better writer

Navid is a great guy. He is reasonable and interesting in class. There is a ton of outside reading and not everything you need to understand is typed in the lectures. You find yourselves have to take notes on his tangents in the recorded lectures.

You will NOT have a single clue on what your grade is. We have had 9 essays and its now finals week and we STILL don't know what we have because they have not been graded. Be prepared to get shot down every-time you answer a question in class as well.

Youll never know what your grade is until the after you take your final. Never offers extra credit. Not a very warm person so be prepared to give and answer to one of his questions and get shot down with no encouragement to ask again
There is a lot of reading and multiple papers. I had no grades until after the final date to drop the class. You will not have a clue about how you are doing in the class.

He gives you lecture slides that have the bare minimum, sometimes having no text at all; you're expected to gather all the information you need from his rambling. The first and only time you're tested on this info is during the final; where he will pick 10 terms out of a list of over 40, and have you define 6. Thats worth 36 points of your final.
